title.persName: Editor : George H Nadel, Executive Editor : Richard T Vann, Associate Editors : Louis O Mink, Richard Buel, Assistant Editor : Jane K Parker, Consultant Editor : W H Dray, Editorial Comitee : Raymond Aron, Isaiah Berlin, Fernand Braudel, E H Gombrich, Sidney Hook, Maurice Mandelbaums, A D Momigliano, John Passmore, W H Waslh, C Vann Woodward

div.p: I am writing to you about tentative plans for assembling a small symposium to discuss Historicism We are at the moment concerned mainly with subject matter. No decisions have yet been made about date, site, nnumers, or foundation support. Fall 1972 or Spring 1973 are probable dates. I should greatly appreciate your help, answers, and comments -- including negative comments.

The overall objectives of the symposium would be any (or all) of the following: (1) To discuss the history of the impact of historicism on some of the established disciplines. (2) To learn where historicism stands today . (3) To attemps to reduce the variety of usages of the term "historicism" to some workable characterization and, as a service to scholarshop, publicize our findings in History and Theory.

It would help in planning to determine what kind or kinds of "historicism" the symposium should usefully confine itself. This need not be in contradiction to objective (3) ; it could be the first step towards it. For example, ProfessorMandelbaum -- at length in his recent History, Man and Reason and more briefly in his enclosed Encyclopedia article -- defines the term as the undestanding of phenomena through their place in a process of development. As a methodological principle, rather than a Weltanschauung , he sees it to be relevant to such current topics of discussion as Piaget's developmentalism, structuralism and as a reevaluation of Marxism (regarding orthodox Marxismas historicist and Marxian humanismas anti-historicist). QUite differnt issues might be raised by other kinds of characterizations, e.g. by Popper's linking of historicism to "holism"(involving i.a. the concepts of "laws") or by the identification of historicism with a concept of "historicity"of relevance to theology).

p.hi: Do you agree that our undertaking requires some prior narrowing down of the term, and if so, have you any wider-ranging associations of "historicismin mind that might usefully be played down or excluded?

div.p: Participating speakers and auditors would mostrly represent specific disciplines.These might include "history" (perhaps a sruvey of the classic development of historicism), "historicim and art history", "historicim and philosophy", "historical theology", "historicim and economics", as wells as, perhaps, "historicism and science" and the more recent "historicism and black history".

p.hi: Would you be willing, in principle, to attend? Could you also let me know on what topic you may wish to read a paper (or shorter comment on some problem, book, or thinker)?

closer.signed: Sincerly George H Nadel, George H Nadel, Warnham Lodge Horsham Susses England
